    • Constructor Detail

      • Minefield

        public Minefield()
        Default no-argument constructor of Minefield. Initializes the fields and indicators at the default values (which are equivalent to the "INTERMEDIATE" level values in 'Constants.java').

      • Minefield

        public Minefield(Minefield m)
        Copy constructor of Minefield. Initializes the fields and indicators to the exact values as the passed Minefield object. The values stored in each field are also copied from the values stored in the passed Minefield object.
        Parameters:
        m - The Minefield object to be copied from.

      • Minefield

        public Minefield(int rows,
                 int columns,
                 int numMines)
        R-C-M Constructor of Minefield. Initializes the fields using the given number of rows, columns and mines. Then, the fields and indicators will be set to their defaulted values.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows the fields will have.
        columns - The number of columns the fields will have.
        numMines - The number of mines that will populate the mine field.

      • Minefield

        public Minefield(int level)
        Difficulty-based constructor of Minefield. Initializes the fields using values based on the given difficulty level. The fields and indicators will then be set to their default values. If the given difficulty level is not an acceptable value, it will output an error.
        Parameters:
        level - The difficulty level to construct the fields.

      • getGameState

        public int getGameState()
        Retrieve the current status of the game.
        Specified by:
        getGameState in interface Model
        Returns:
        The integer representing the current game status.

      • updateGameState

        public void updateGameState()
        Update the current status of the game. Based on the 'mine found' and 'game over' indicators, the game status will be updated accordingly. If the game status already show the game has ended, nothing happens; if the game has not ended, the status is set to "Ongoing"; if the game has ended but no mine was found, the status is set to "Win"; otherwise, the game ended with a mine being found, thus the status is set to "Lose".
        Specified by:
        updateGameState in interface Model

      • getVisibleField

        public int[][] getVisibleField()
        Retrieve the visible field array. Returns a copy the 2D array of visibility values for the field.
        Specified by:
        getVisibleField in interface Model
        Returns:
        The 2D integer array of visibility values for the field.

      • getVisibleValue

        public int getVisibleValue(int x,
                           int y)
        Retrieve the visibility value of a cell. Using the given row (x) and column (y) values of a cell, this function will return the value stored in the visible field array. If the cell values do not exist in the array, the function will return -1.
        Specified by:
        getVisibleValue in interface Model
        Parameters:
        x - The row value of the cell.
        y - The column value of the cell.
        Returns:
        The visibility value at index [x, y]; -1 if index [x, y] does not exist.

      • setVisibleValue

        public int setVisibleValue(int x,
                           int y,
                           int visibility)
        Set the visibility value of a cell. Using the given row (x) and column (y) values of a cell, this function will set the value of the cell in the visibility field to the given visibility value. If the cell values do not exist in the array, the function will return -1.
        Specified by:
        setVisibleValue in interface Model
        Parameters:
        x - The row value of the cell.
        y - The column value of the cell.
        visibility - The desired visibility value at index [x, y]; -1 if index [x, y] does not exist.
        Returns:
        0 for success; 1 for failure

      • getMineValue

        public int getMineValue(int x,
                        int y)
        Retrieve the mine value of a cell. Using the given row (x) and column (y) values of a cell, this function will return the value stored in the mine field array. If the cell values do not exist in the array, the function will return -1.
        Specified by:
        getMineValue in interface Model
        Parameters:
        x - The row value of the cell.
        y - The column value of the cell.
        Returns:
        The mine value at index [x, y]; -1 if index [x, y] does not exist.

      • setMineValue

        public int setMineValue(int x,
                        int y,
                        int mine_value)
        Set the mine value of a cell. Using the given row (x) and column (y) values of a cell, this function will set the value of the cell in the mine field to the given mine value. If the cell values do not exist in the array, the function will return -1.
        Specified by:
        setMineValue in interface Model
        Parameters:
        x - The row value of the cell.
        y - The column value of the cell.
        mine_value - The desired mine value at index [x, y]; -1 if index [x, y] does not exist.
        Returns:
        0 for success; 1 for failure

      • redoField

        public void redoField(int rows,
                      int columns,
                      int numMines)
        Rebuilds the field based on the given number of rows, columns and mines. Reconstructs the fields using the given number of rows, columns and mines. The fields, status and indicators are then set to their default values.
        Specified by:
        redoField in interface Model
        Parameters:
        rows - The desired new number of rows
        columns - The desired new number of columns
        numMines - The desired new number of mines

      • resetField

        public void resetField()
        Set both arrays, state, indicators and available flags to their default values. The number of available flags will be set to the number of mines in the field (as its maximum), and the 'game over' and 'mine found' indicators will be set to False. Each 2D-index of both the visibility and mine fields will be set to their default values: the visibility value is defaulted to the standard "HIDDEN" value; the mine value is defaulted to 0 (indicating a "blank space").
        Specified by:
        resetField in interface Model

      • minesLastStanding

        public boolean minesLastStanding()
        Determine whether the remaining hidden cells on the field are all hiding mines.
        Specified by:
        minesLastStanding in interface Model
        Returns:
        True if all remaining hidden cells have a mine; False otherwise.
